result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 6th and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI 6th and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Debora K Haldeman-Turner was found guilty of OWI 6th, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for any administrative suspension.

Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to defendant obtaining a valid driver's license or occupational license.  However, the length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued.  (Call Dept of Motor Vehicles with questions).

miscConds.notes: $50 represents the ignition interlock surcharge.  Plus supervision fees.    If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment & follow through with recommended treatment
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol or illegal drugs or any prescription drugs not prescribed.    Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  Not to drive w/o a valid Wisconsin driver's license.    Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.    Not to drive with any alcohol in system.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant to report directly to Dunn County if at no cost to Chippewa County.  Huber for work release.  1 day credit.  Electronic monitoring if qualifies.
Pursuant to a Motion and Order dated February 26, 2015, the remainder of Defendant's jail time as a condition of probation is stayed pending her compliance with the rules of probation and with the requirements of drug court, and that she be released effective February 26, 2015.
Defendant to complete fifty (50) hours every six (6) months.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
